meanings.definition: An ancient Roman official responsible for financial matters.
meanings.sent1: The quaestors managed the city's money.
meanings.sent2: In ancient Rome, quaestors were in charge of finances.
meanings.sent3: The quaestors joked about counting coins all day.
meanings.sent4: The quaestors were the financial wizards of their time.
meanings.sent5: The role of quaestors involved handling financial affairs with precision.

meanings.definition: A group of officials in charge of public funds in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The quaestors worked together to oversee public funds.
meanings.sent2: Ancient Rome had a dedicated group of quaestors for managing funds.
meanings.sent3: The quaestors held a meeting to discuss the city's budget.
meanings.sent4: The unity among the quaestors ensured the financial stability of Rome.
meanings.sent5: The responsibilities of quaestors included safeguarding public finances.
